data.text:
"This is about turning apathetic people into climate activists."

-- @SophiaKianni, the youngest climate activist selected to be part of @antonioguterres' Youth Advisory Group on climate change, explains why there can be no delay in #ClimateAction.

https://t.co/Kg2O87nocx

The conflict in Yemen and the #COVID19 crisis are disproportionately affecting women & girls. 

@UN_Women is supporting projects that build women’s self-reliance & independence. https://t.co/oktQKhtqny

110,000+ people have already expressed their support for: 

Peace
Human rights
Equality 
Dignity for all

Join them by adding your image to photo filters that promote UN values for our 75th birthday! 

https://t.co/CquddbNlhR #UN75 https://t.co/V9gaUG18ii

Through unity & compassion can we protect each other & end the global #coronavirus pandemic. 

Get inspired with our latest @Twitter moment. https://t.co/7IUiOr3j22

All migrants should be able to access health services without facing discrimination.

@UNMigration works to ensure migrants everywhere are included in #COVID19 responses & their basic rights are protected. https://t.co/fGSF1aWgU6 https://t.co/S3r2pKKXUO

Over 2/3 of the world's refugees come from just 5 countries:
🇸🇾 Syria
🇻🇪 Venezuela
🇦🇫 Afghanistan
🇸🇸 South Sudan
🇲🇲 Myanmar

See how @refugees is helping them: https://t.co/SGIEXcO8lF

https://t.co/TmrmU12K3G

#COVID19 has exposed the fragility of our world. 

As we sow the seeds to shape our future beyond the #coronavirus pandemic, the #GlobalGoals remain our best road map to recover better.
https://t.co/1dDso3XhD9 https://t.co/zMAcbwV80u

It may not always make the headlines -- but the UN works all over the world to prevent conflict and keep peace & stability.

As the UN turns 75, see how else the Organization makes a difference in the lives of everyone, everywhere:  https://t.co/Z1mKcW36cl #UN75 https://t.co/cTWUOfboNX

"We have seen, in quite a number of countries, an increase in gender-based violence."

Hear from @WHO's @MoetiTshidi as she shares her concerns on #COVID19 - & its impact on women’s lives - with @MelissaFleming in the latest episode of Awake At Night.

🎧: https://t.co/UeVKE2oNmG https://t.co/r9Dg4X5Vvd

"As in other parts of the world, the health, economic & political impact of #COVID19 has been significant across Southeast Asia — hitting the most vulnerable the hardest."

-- @antonioguterres on consequences of #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/KlMEAIgKEp https://t.co/xIwFXXNGb7

300 million tonnes of plastic waste is produced each year -- 8 million tonnes of which end up in the ocean. 🌊

Changing small, daily habits can have a big impact on #CleanSeas! via @UNEP
https://t.co/ojzREV936q

Misinformation is spreading faster than #COVID19 itself, and is designed to exploit our emotions and biases.

So pause, and take time to verify facts before you share something online. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare

https://t.co/9cNARGlEUN https://t.co/xl0JrHtjIM

#COVID19 is changing our world, but with the right approach we can build back better & stronger.

Recycling, reusing, planting trees - there are many ways you can take #ClimateAction & do your part to make the world a better place.

https://t.co/ObsefnV2ok https://t.co/zfnkqyFvxB

Indigenous peoples are at disproportionate risk in public health emergencies such as #COVID19.

Follow @UN4Indigenous for updates on the #coronavirus crisis and its impact on indigenous communities. https://t.co/BbVZ4usYz8 https://t.co/AOPzwWZqAA

Physical distancing does not have to mean social or emotional isolation.

Connect with your loved ones. We are in this together -- and we will get through this together.

🧑‍🎨: Karina Muranaga https://t.co/hAHAcSd70s

#COVID19 will push 71 to 100 million people into extreme poverty in 2020. 

The @WorldBank aims to support vulnerable countries to increase the transparency of their debt and enable them to prevent & mitigate a debt crisis. 
https://t.co/BRVPb11no9

"Now is our chance to recover better, by building more resilient, inclusive & sustainable cities."

-- @antonioguterres calls on leaders to tackle inequalities & protect the most vulnerable in cities as we recover from #COVID19. https://t.co/ux9uAIGT6q https://t.co/QzOychwMSE

To shape the future, your voice matters.
Together, we can get through #COVID19. 
Together, we can build a better world.

Share your ideas with us: https://t.co/UMhU0s3XuZ

#UN75 https://t.co/kCrwF4Sne5

Misinformation is causing global harm, hampering our ability to make progress on many of the world’s most pressing issues.

So pause & take time to verify facts before you share something online. https://t.co/9cNARGlEUN #TakeCareBeforeYouShare https://t.co/tAPN1IbqHC

In Latin America, many indigenous people lack access to health facilities or clean water & are particularly hit by #COVID19.

@MelissaFleming talks with @eclac_un chief @aliciabarcena on the health risks faced by indigenous communities. 

Have a listen 🎵

https://t.co/PXiq23yrBO

The #COVID19 crisis is resulting in an increase in gender-based violence worldwide. 

Yet, violence against women is preventable, even during the #coronavirus pandemic. @UN_Women explains. https://t.co/e13cUN2gH7

A "use-it-&-toss-it" culture is leading to an abundance of trash, most of which will never be recycled. 

See how you can #ActNow to ensure sustainable consumption & production to protect our planet: https://t.co/iTIbjR8Ofe https://t.co/D4HFPznke7

#LGBTI rights = HUMAN rights

❤️🧡💛💚💙💜

Join UN @free_equal in the fight against transphobia & homophobia. https://t.co/9opL2WuLVd https://t.co/JaipyAs6xl

What we share online can have consequences in the real world. 

Pause - and verify facts before sharing. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare. 

https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/qPJNeNM2oF

A woman with #COVID19 should be supported to:
🤱🏻 breastfeed safely
🤱🏼 hold her newborn skin-to-skin
🤱🏾 share a room with her baby 

World Breastfeeding Week starts Saturday. 

More on #coronavirus & breastfeeding via @WHO: https://t.co/I0VEOg97wY https://t.co/uJlL1I5guM

"We need to help people feel in control."

-- @WHOAFRO chief @MoetiTshidi on how to sustain behaviours that help prevent the spread of #COVID19 in latest episode of our 'Awake at Night' podcast with @melissafleming. https://t.co/UeVKE2Goee https://t.co/HkeDSnzjC3

With the #COVID19 pandemic placing so many of the world’s children in jeopardy, I appeal to leaders at all levels: protect our children and safeguard their well-being.

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/zjS0W8q2xq https://t.co/05Muwoq5mv

#PlasticFreeJuly comes to an end but here are a few tips to help #BeatPlasticPollution all year round:

🍴Refuse plastic utensils
💦Use refillable bottles
🛍 Bring your own shopping bags 

More actions you can take to protect our planet: https://t.co/JEL5HWUoZF https://t.co/SrWGTfGHu9

عيد مبارك

#EidMubarak! Wishing all those who are celebrating a happy, safe and peaceful #EidAlAdha. https://t.co/yerVbCB570

The worldwide response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity. People are spreading kindness through their words & deeds -- while inspiring others to do the same.

No act of goodwill is too small in the fight against #coronavirus.

🎨: Margaret To https://t.co/1RPwrZpgdT

In the new episode of our UN podcast, @MelissaFleming talks with the 1st female @WHO Regional Director for Africa @MoetiTshidi.

🔊 Listen to her powerful story & her fears about the effect of #coronavirus, especially on women. https://t.co/UeVKE2Goee https://t.co/V6cPjEb7y0

In rural India, not everyone has access to verified information about #COVID19.

See how @GramVaani, a voice-based community platform is helping provide accurate & up-to-date information. 

https://t.co/WdwMDqm3c1 https://t.co/ebfk2ORUAp

#EidMubarak!

Wishing all those who are celebrating a happy and peaceful #EidAlAdha. https://t.co/a3vML4htfG

"As in other parts of the world, the health, economic & political impact of #COVID19 has been significant across Southeast Asia — hitting the most vulnerable the hardest."

-- @antonioguterres on impact of #coronavirus. https://t.co/KlMEAIgKEp https://t.co/wp277sg134

In 2019, nearly 34 million children were living in displacement camps, missing out on their childhood and living in fear.

See how @Refugees is working to help restore their futures. https://t.co/iGrU383TuN 

https://t.co/OIWPsm0kgN

Friends don't let friends share misinformation.

On Thursday's #FriendshipDay and every day -- pause, and verify facts before sharing online. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare

https://t.co/WdwMDq4rNr https://t.co/IOUowdpW70

1/3 of our food is lost or wasted every year. Here's how you can help:
🛒 Shop smarter
🥘 Improve food storage
🥡 Eat left-overs

More from @FAO: https://t.co/1wBoORa0XO https://t.co/MKwl5yAlEV

"If the world is to put human dignity & human rights at the centre of the #COVID19 response & recovery, we need to do more to protect trafficking victims."

-- @antonioguterres on Thursday's #EndHumanTrafficking Day. https://t.co/HMVQHTzGbc https://t.co/Ctxo9xPQkj

Thursday is #FriendshipDay! 🤗

Physical distancing during #COVID19 does not have to mean social or emotional isolation.
📲Connect with your friends
💙Be kind 

We are in this together -- & we will get through this together. https://t.co/7sFzedeiQL

🎨: Leyah Mirza https://t.co/SzM9zIkRbD

No part of our planet is immune to human trafficking.

On Thursday's #EndHumanTrafficking Day, join @UNODC in honoring all frontline workers who are assisting human trafficking victims amid #COVID19. https://t.co/BjxS7pkjdA https://t.co/ZKjzAcn9P3

The Syrian economy, devastated by nearly a decade of conflict, has entered a period of extreme fragility. Families across the country can no longer afford the very basics.

-- @UNReliefChief to Security Council on Wednesday. https://t.co/78XeUNgTV9

Desert locusts are destroying crops in East Africa and Yemen, threatening food security in the region.

See how @FAO is fighting the desert locust outbreak from the sky 🚁 to protect 500,000 households from hunger. https://t.co/yBIo6jzeMn https://t.co/FlkEuMsRPR

"False information travels faster & farther than the truth."

-- @DoctorYasmin, Director of @Stanford Health Communication Initiative has tips on separating facts from fiction. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare

https://t.co/WdwMDq4rNr https://t.co/25dJSxU42u

Misinformation is dangerous & can hamper our ability to make progress on global issues.

So take a moment to pause and verify facts before sharing online. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare. 

https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/CtSgtCkx7m

Misinformation is spreading faster than #COVID19 itself, disrupting public health efforts.

See how young people in Egypt are countering misinformation by sharing verified messages on #coronavirus. https://t.co/3q2pn4I0Pe via @UN_SDG https://t.co/RrkMNuj6M4

Everyone has the right to a nationality.

Yet, millions around the world have been denied their right to a nationality, preventing them from going to school, seeing a doctor, getting a job, or even getting married.

See how @Refugees is helping: https://t.co/ABRn5GFjuD https://t.co/GqkA7AfdIp

Over the last century, tiger population has declined by 95%, due to habitat loss & wildlife trafficking. Today, there are more tigers in captivity than in the wild.

Help protect tigers on Wednesday's #TigerDay & every day: https://t.co/5L0lZJ7lTv https://t.co/MCPas16cmr

Yemen: @UNReliefChief & @OSE_Yemen call for an immediate ceasefire, and warn the country could enter a new phase of prolonged escalation, uncontrolled spread of #COVID19 & economic decline.

https://t.co/PxijN11syg

🦠 Disease outbreaks
🏭 Pollution
🌪️ Extreme weather events
🌊 Earthquakes & tsunamis
☢️ Technological hazards

Preparing for all types of disasters can save millions of lives. https://t.co/OTYaZGuG4B via @UNDRR https://t.co/PbYrCZkY9S

"Now is our chance to recover better, by building more resilient, inclusive & sustainable cities."

-- @antonioguterres on Tuesday called on leaders to tackle inequalities, protect the most vulnerable in cities, as we recover from #COVID19. https://t.co/ux9uAIYtXY https://t.co/UDWkekjMyA

Lost jobs & incomes due to #COVID19 has led to an increase in the number of people facing acute food insecurity.

@WFP & @FAO highlights 27 countries at risk of
significant food security deterioration, hunger &  malnutrition. https://t.co/AGCybixmtz

https://t.co/cmxXhwdAIT

“I urge young people everywhere to keep driving #ClimateAction forward. We need you more than ever.”

-- @antonioguterres launching Youth Advisory Group to provide perspectives, ideas & solutions for addressing the climate crisis. https://t.co/HxP7zJ2XhO https://t.co/AeoN0DNEee

The proportion of children under five chronically infected with hepatitis B fell to under 1% in 2019 from around 5% in the pre-vaccine era.

More from @WHO on Tuesday's #WorldHepatitisDay: https://t.co/wKueFAcZk5 https://t.co/RnukEOaIp1

Now — more than ever,
your voice matters,
your ideas matter. 

Share your solutions for a better future, as the UN marks 75 years of working on behalf of people everywhere.

https://t.co/mcajceBlG8  #UN75 https://t.co/9KvsqbXgAh

➡️ Hepatitis attacks the most vulnerable.
➡️ Viral hepatitis B & C are root causes of liver cancer.
➡️ Timely testing & treatment can save lives.

More on Tuesday's #WorldHepatitisDay: https://t.co/uAm4CG1BR1 https://t.co/Xvg60ku5Yd

Women & children made up more than 40% of all civilian casualties in the Afghanistan conflict during first half of 2020.

New @UNAMAnews report calls on all parties to start peace talks, prioritize civilian protection, & address needs & rights of victims. https://t.co/pobD3bSE5g https://t.co/cf4VSRUE82

Athletes around the world showed us what they are doing to help fight #COVID19. 

All of us have a role to play during the #coronavirus crisis. 

So, whatever you have done so far to prevent the spread, #KeepItUp!

https://t.co/zzYaeEsJ0j https://t.co/QzxaO1QqC8

Camera traps are a great tool for studying wildlife and estimating species' diversity & abundance.

See how @FAO is working to conserve wildlife, protect ecosystems and support local communities dependent on these resources. https://t.co/9DHCvOg1iO

https://t.co/19PSDj1ZbV

The #COVID19 pandemic is taking a huge toll on the mental health & wellbeing of workers, employers and managers alike. 

New @ILO guidelines aim to help them cope in the "new normal". https://t.co/YYlgfh535I

The number of people experiencing acute hunger could increase to 270 million this year due to #COVID19 — that's 82% more people than before the pandemic.

See how @WFP is stepping up efforts to address global food insecurity. https://t.co/b28g3svxYC https://t.co/FzusmGaxeU

"I ask all members of society to join hands and help each other to overcome this crisis & establish peace in all of Iraq.”

— Read how Akram and other Iraqis are expressing solidarity & hope amid the #COVID19 crisis. via @UNDPinIraq
https://t.co/ZI2z3FvBek

Misinformation is causing global harm, hampering our ability to make progress on many of the world’s most pressing issues.

We can all take action now. Pause & take time to verify facts before you share something online. https://t.co/9cNARGlEUN #TakeCareBeforeYouShare https://t.co/KixvcgW6Bb

"The #COVID19 pandemic has exposed fault lines, fissures & fragilities in societies & economies around the world — & the Arab region is no exception."

-- @antonioguterres says the crisis is an opportunity for the Arab region to build back better. https://t.co/gvvgRLSEf5 https://t.co/pnXWaItS60

The UN is working all around the world to fight #coronavirus and mitigate its impact.

Season 3 of @MelissaFleming's podcast focuses on extraordinary UN staff members who devote their lives to helping others, including during the #COVID19 crisis. 

🎧: https://t.co/4C9nNQISfZ https://t.co/Et5L41LO9Z

110,000+ people have already expressed their support for: 

Peace
Human rights
Equality 
Dignity for all

Join them by adding your image to photo filters that promote the UN's values on our 75th birthday! 

https://t.co/Cquddc4W9p #UN75 https://t.co/sGQGb6z5EQ

"#COVID19 is a human tragedy. 

But it has also created a generational opportunity - an opportunity to build back a more equal and sustainable world."

-- @antonioguterres in the annual @NelsonMandela lecture. https://t.co/d7CvMcoCRM https://t.co/6w6nuQMaWQ

“Wearing masks can be annoying & hot, but we don’t mind. We want to succeed in our exams & that is all that counts for us.” 

Hadeel studies at an @UNRWA-supported school in Syria, where learning is continuing despite #COVID19. https://t.co/kpiznmA8DH https://t.co/0Muui9pXAc

For two decades, the @GlobalCompact has been working towards #UnitingBusiness for a better world. 

On its 20th anniversary, see how it works to ensure businesses uphold universal principles of human rights, labour, environment & anti-corruption. https://t.co/eyTxbK8sB4 https://t.co/sVmfabNvGs

Mangroves are rare ecosystems on the boundary between land & sea. 

On Sunday's #MangroveDay, find out from @UNESCO how mangroves can help address the climate crisis: https://t.co/u8d81li13t https://t.co/MM2AyxYXUe

Forests cover 1/3 of land globally & are home to 80% of life on land. 

Yet, biodiversity conservation has slowed in the last decade.

More from @FAO on how the world’s forests are changing. https://t.co/GBny023rkp #FRA2020 https://t.co/NtxamvBYEJ

Human rights belong to everyone, everywhere - no matter who you are or whom you love.

❤️🧡💛💚💙💜

Join @free_equal in the fight against transphobia & homophobia: https://t.co/Ljui9G92Ag #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/iqNqtaBMum

What we share online can have consequences in the real world. 

Pause - and verify facts before sharing. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare. https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/7tIa4aSQIZ

Whatever you are doing to stop the spread of #COVID19 – keep it up. 
Preventing the further spread of #coronavirus is a shared responsibility for us all.  

🎨: Karina Muranaga https://t.co/0m2fLpLKRM

#COVID19 is threatening livelihoods & could affect food security for millions of people. 

@UNDP is working to protect life under water and build back better. https://t.co/im3MV2UnAr

📖 It’s storytime! 

With many children spending more time at home due to the #coronavirus crisis, the UN has ideas about how families can use the pandemic as an opportunity to connect & share solutions for a better future.

https://t.co/C959ZRqJvE

“The climate emergency is a danger to peace.”

-- @UNDPPA’s Miroslav Jenca tells Security Council that the climate crisis poses a risk to international peace & security, and calls for urgent #ClimateAction to protect fragile & conflict-prone countries.
https://t.co/jmiYr7CTNr

#COVID19 lockdown measures have left many indigenous people in Latin America unable to travel to cities to earn an income. 

@WFP has been helping vulnerable families meet their basic nutritional needs. https://t.co/15zu06PXej https://t.co/oUyq86nv1J

The world's 67 million domestic workers  - the vast majority of which are women - are facing unique challenges during the #COVID19 crisis. 

The UN is working to protect domestic workers, as they struggle to stay safe & maintain their livelihoods. 

https://t.co/IIbS8K7r7R

Misinformation is spreading faster than #COVID19 itself, disrupting public health efforts & distorting sound scientific guidance.

We can all take action now to prevent the spread of misinformation. Pause and #TakeCareBeforeYouShare. https://t.co/9cNARGlEUN https://t.co/NMxshr7BWA

Lost jobs & incomes due to #COVID19 have led to a socio-economic crisis, which is deepening already existing inequalities.

Providing a temporary basic income could help the poorest & most vulnerable withstand the crisis. https://t.co/XseaoouSOF via @UNDP https://t.co/BSiALTQT6X

690 million people are chronically hungry worldwide & 2 billion people lack access to safe & nutritious food.

More must be done to reduce the cost of nutritious foods & make healthy diets affordable. https://t.co/4uT9LmBPBk #SOFI2020 via @FAO https://t.co/WIrQmHYpBn

"There must be synergy between our responses to the health, development & climate challenges."

-- newly elected @UNECOSOC President stresses need to address urgent, wide-ranging issues in the year ahead. https://t.co/xzgk8yz4NN

Syria: The tragedy of detainees, abductees and missing people representative of humanitarian catastrophe that has engulfed country, Security Council told, as @UNEnvoySyria calls for release of those being held & meaningful action for the missing. https://t.co/tnjXRk3DcI

"The #COVID19 pandemic has exposed fault lines, fissures & fragilities in societies & economies around the world — & the Arab region is no exception."

-- @antonioguterres says the crisis is an opportunity for the Arab region to build back better. https://t.co/gvvgRLSEf5 https://t.co/a75p1lBGdW

https://t.co/8VwRrvAcRV

From the #COVID19 pandemic to the climate crisis, the UN has been at the forefront of finding solutions to challenges that respect no borders.

At #UN75, let's take #ClimateAction to create a future of prosperity & well-being, while protecting our planet. https://t.co/JErkY8CGEE https://t.co/iUdoTiVxi7

3 years after its liberation, Mosul is on the rise.

@UNESCO & partners are working to revive the spirit of the iconic Iraqi city by:

🕌 rehabilitating its heritage sites
🏫 rebuilding schools & ensuring quality
🎶 revitalizing its cultural life

https://t.co/9oZeEAzmTj https://t.co/tfx6fin8Zg

.@WHO & partners have launched a joint effort to enhance research & development of traditional medicines to support the #COVID19 response in Africa. Read more: https://t.co/GL6uwSMpZ4 via @WHOAfro https://t.co/eGiQtisVga

300 million tonnes of plastic waste is produced each year -- 8 million tonnes of which end up in the ocean. 🌊

-- @aminajmohammed calls for a united economic front to recover better from #COVID19 and implement measures that build resilience against future shocks.

Pause — take a breath and be mindful about what you share. #TakeCareBeforeYouShare

🩺 Head physician 
🏥 #coronavirus outreach programme lead
🧕🏼 First & only refugee doctor

https://t.co/vND8ARUsdO

Yemen: 100,000+ people have been forced to flee violence in the country this year.

Now, #COVID19 is emerging as a new cause of internal displacement. @UNMigration is providing humanitarian assistance & protection to those most in need. https://t.co/rwt8BwyyC6

“We simply cannot allow the #coronavirus to threaten the lives & future of women.” 

Despite challenges posed by #COVID19, @UN_PGA calls for accelerated efforts to achieve gender equality goals outlined 25 years ago in Beijing Platform for Action. https://t.co/OQ1mFVyHvh

The ferocity of #COVID19 and its devastating human & economic toll demand extraordinary measures that rise above politics-as-usual.

--@nmladenov on need for cooperation & solidarity between Israeli & Palestinian leaders amid #coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/WnOe2v8RvW
